block.p: Katherine Cutter Bardel and Robert Seifert Hamblet, both teachers at the Potomac School in McLean, Va., were married yesterday by the Rev. Robert L. Ficks III at St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington, Conn. The bride wore a wedding gown that was made in 1878 for her great-great-grandmother.
The bride teaches English and the bridegroom teaches history. He is also the director of Potomac's summer programs.

Katherine Cutter Bardel and Robert Seifert Hamblet, both teachers at the Potomac School in McLean, Va., were married yesterday by the Rev. Robert L. Ficks III at St. John's Episcopal Church in Washington, Conn. The bride wore a wedding gown that was made in 1878 for her great-great-grandmother.
The bride teaches English and the bridegroom teaches history. He is also the director of Potomac's summer programs.

Mrs. Hamblet, 31, graduated from Yale and received a master's degree in Victorian studies from Oxford University in England. She is the daughter of Penelope and William G. Bardel of Lawrenceville, N.J. Her father, a former managing director of Lehman Brothers in New York, is an associate headmaster and the chief financial officer at the Lawrenceville School. Her mother, a former associate director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, teaches English at Lawrenceville.

Mr. Hamblet, 33, graduated from Georgetown and received a master's degree in history from the College of William and Mary. His parents, Phyllis and William P. Hamblet, live in Meredith, N.H., where they own and operate Y-Landing Marina on Lake Winnipesaukee.
